de.unistuttgart.vis.wearable.os.graph

Class AbstractLiveGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unistuttgart.vis.wearable.os.graph.AbstractLiveGraph

  • public abstract class AbstractLiveGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    Can create a livegraph for a specific PSensor
    Author:
    pfaehlfd

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractLiveGraph(PSensor pSensor, int numberOfValuesToShow, android.content.Context context, int graphsPerSecond)
      Registers a value changed callback for the given PSensor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void acceptGraph(android.view.View graph)
      Has to be implemented by the subclass.
      void reregisterCallback()
      Reregisters a value changed callback for the in the constructor given PSensor, so the graph gets updated if the sensor value changes.
      void unRegisterCallback()
      Unregisters the value changed callback, so the graph wont get updated anymore.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractLiveGraph

        public AbstractLiveGraph(PSensor pSensor,
                         int numberOfValuesToShow,
                         android.content.Context context,
                         int graphsPerSecond)
        Registers a value changed callback for the given PSensor. If the value of the Sensor changes the acceptGraph method will be called.
        Parameters:
        pSensor - the sensor to listen at.
        numberOfValuesToShow - the maximum number of values to show in the graph.
        context - the android context.
        graphsPerSecond - the maximum number of graphs per second you want.

    • Method Detail

      • acceptGraph

        public abstract void acceptGraph(android.view.View graph)
        Has to be implemented by the subclass. This method gets called when a new graph is available.
        Parameters:
        graph - the new graph e.g. implementation for LinearLayout chart: chart.removeAllViews(); chart.addView(graph);

      • unRegisterCallback

        public void unRegisterCallback()
        Unregisters the value changed callback, so the graph wont get updated anymore.

      • reregisterCallback

        public void reregisterCallback()
        Reregisters a value changed callback for the in the constructor given PSensor, so the graph gets updated if the sensor value changes.
